meta.name: description
meta.content: QDA is a non-profit Ohio public K-12 Online School that opened in 2003 with offices in New Phila, Berlin, East Liverpool, and Steubenville. The Freedom to Learn from Anywhere!

p.span: To see available resources to contact QDA, please click here.

hr.p:
As COVID-19 / Coronavirus continues to evolve and new information comes out each day, we will continue to provide you updates. The education, safety, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community are our first priority. The following is information to keep you up-to-date:
→ QDA operations for student learning will remain the same. Students are expected to continue working.
→ Our office staff is still available via phone, email, and video conferencing.
→For the safety of our staff, there will be no in-person activities.
→Testing Update:
→ All testing has been postponed until further notice.
→ We will update you as soon as information is available.

p.span: We will continue to be in touch via phone and email with important information. Parents are encouraged to call their instructional supervisor or main QDA phone number with questions, device issues, or student assistance:
Thank you for your patience, understanding, and support.

-QDA Staff
IS Staff Directory can be found here.

p.span:
March 17, 2020 (please scroll down to see prior announcements)
Dear Students and Families,

We wanted to provide you with a list of available resources so you can continue to reach the staff at QDA. Fortunately, QDA has the resources and ability to quickly adapt to these ever changing times to ensure students can continue to learn and be supported.
The Instructional Supervisor directory can be found here:
Please call a mobile number, email, or contact your Instructional Supervisor through the Maestro Student Information System. Desk phones will be forwarded to secondary numbers whenever possible.

p.b: Contacting QDA for General Questions and Support

p.span: Please call 1-866-968-7032 / 330-364-0618 to speak to a QDA staff member.
If prompted:
-Press 1 for non-technical support questions.

-Press 2 for technical support.
-Press 3 for the latest information on State Testing (all testing is postponed until further notice).
-Press 4 for the Instructional Supervisor directory.
Email: information@go2qda.org
QDA has multiple channels available for technical support:
-Answers to frequently asked questions can be found at
-Email: tech_support@go2qda.org
-Text or Call: 330-556-0668
We will continue to be in touch via phone and email with important information.
Thank you,
QDA Staff
As COVID-19 / Coronavirus continues to evolve and new information comes out each day, we will continue to provide you updates.
The education, safety, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community are our first priority.
The following is information to keep you up-to-date:

li.span: QDA operations for student learning will remain the same. Students are expected to continue working.
Our office staff is still available via phone, email, and video conferencing.
For the safety of our staff, there will be no in-person activities.
All testing has been postponed until further notice.
We will update you as soon as information is available.

p.span: We will continue to be in touch via phone and email with important information. Parents are encouraged to call their instructional supervisor or the main QDA phone number with questions, device issues, or student assistance:
Thank you for your patience, understanding, and support.
- QDA Staff

hr.hr:
Tips for your safety: The best way to prevent illness is to take every-day preventative actions to help prevent the spread of respiratory diseases, including:
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom; before eating; and after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing. If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol. Always wash hands with soap and water if your hands are visibly dirty.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.
Stay home if you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces at home, work and school.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Additional resources:
For the latest Ohio-specific developments, please visit the Ohio Department of Health’s coronavirus disease 2019 resources webpage.
For the latest from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, please visit the CDC coronavirus disease 2019 webpage.
Future Updates
QDA will provide additional updates on this page (https://go2qda.org/coronavirus) and through the Maestro Student Information System as needed.

div.div: You need to enable user registration from User Manager/Options in the backend of Joomla before this module will activate.

div.span: Copyright © 2020. QDA: An Ohio K-12 Online School.

p.span: QDA (Quaker Digital Academy) is K-12 public school for Ohio students. QDA is an Ohio non-profit online school with offices in New Philadelphia, Berlin, East Liverpool, and Steubenville. QDA provides students with a computer system, tutoring services, an academic coach, and access to hundreds of online courses. QDA is a tuition free school. Contact QDA today at 1-866-968-7032 or complete an information request to learn more about QDA.
